DOC.brief_title: Intensive Outpatient Versus Outpatient Treatment With Buprenorphine Among African Americans
DOC.detailed_description: This two-group randomized clinical trial test effectiveness intensive outpatient ( IOP ) v. standard outpatient ( OP ) treatment 272 heroin-dependent African American adult receive buprenorphine 2 formerly `` drug-free '' program . Participants randomly assign one two treatment intensity condition intake assessed baseline , 3- , 6-months post-baseline determine treatment retention , frequency severity heroin cocaine use , self-reported HIV-risk , quality life , determine DSM-IV criterion Full Partial Remission Opioid Dependence . Furthermore , patient factor potentially critical treatment success ( e.g. , attitude towards buprenorphine average buprenorphine dose treatment ) examine determine importance influence treatment outcome . Moreover , patient staff attitude average buprenorphine dose evaluate determine respective relationship treatment experience treatment retention .
